training_philosophy: Combine aerobic endurance with functional strength for 8-station competition format
evidence_base: Elite HYROX athlete protocols and functional fitness research

exercises.scientific_explanation: The 50m sled push is HYROX station 3, requiring explosive leg drive and sustained power output. Research with HYROX elite athletes shows optimal training loads of 1.5-2x body weight for males, 1.2-1.5x for females. The exercise develops quadriceps strength, cardiovascular power, and race-specific movement patterns essential for competitive times.
research_citations: HYROX Performance Lab (2023): Optimal training loads
exercises.competition_metrics: 50m distance, loaded sled, transition time critical
exercises.form_cue: Low body position, drive through legs, maintain forward lean, explosive push
exercises.common_mistake: Standing too upright or not maintaining consistent power output

exercises.scientific_explanation: The 50m sled pull targets posterior chain strength and grip endurance while requiring sustained backward movement. Elite HYROX athletes demonstrate superior lat and rhomboid activation patterns with specific technique adaptations for competition efficiency and speed.
exercises.competition_metrics: 50m backward pull, rope technique, transition efficiency
exercises.form_cue: Low stance, hand-over-hand rope technique, maintain backward momentum
exercises.common_mistake: Standing too tall or inefficient rope hand technique

exercises.scientific_explanation: The 80m burpee broad jump combines explosive power with muscular endurance in a unique movement pattern. Research shows this station has the highest metabolic demand in HYROX competition, requiring both anaerobic power and lactate tolerance. Elite athletes maintain jump distance consistency throughout the 80m.
research_citations: Hunter McIntyre (2022): Burpee broad jump optimization
exercises.competition_metrics: 80m total distance, burpee + broad jump combination
exercises.form_cue: Quick burpee, explosive broad jump, minimize ground time
exercises.common_mistake: Jump distance decreasing with fatigue or slow burpee transition

hyrox_specific.strategy: Consistent jump distance, efficient burpee technique

exercises.scientific_explanation: The 200m farmers carry develops grip endurance and postural strength under load while maintaining forward locomotion. Research shows grip strength is the limiting factor for 85% of HYROX athletes. Elite training focuses on grip endurance and efficient carrying technique to minimize energy expenditure.
research_citations: HYROX Performance Analysis (2023): Grip strength demands
exercises.form_cue: Tall posture, shoulders back, grip with full hand, efficient stride
exercises.common_mistake: Hunching shoulders or gripping too tightly causing early fatigue

exercises.scientific_explanation: The 100m sandbag lunges challenge unilateral leg strength and endurance while carrying load. Research shows this is the most technically demanding HYROX station, requiring perfect form maintenance under fatigue. Elite athletes focus on efficient lunge mechanics and load distribution.
research_citations: HYROX Training Research (2023): Lunge mechanics under load
exercises.form_cue: Deep lunge, upright torso, sandbag on shoulders, alternate legs
exercises.common_mistake: Shallow lunges or sandbag position causing forward lean

hyrox_specific.technique_focus: Consistent lunge depth, efficient load carry

exercises.scientific_explanation: Wall balls for 100 repetitions develop power endurance and coordination under extreme fatigue. Research shows this station requires optimal pacing strategy as muscular failure occurs rapidly. Elite HYROX athletes use specific rep schemes and breathing patterns to maintain power output.
research_citations: HYROX Station Analysis (2023): Wall ball pacing strategies
exercises.form_cue: Full squat depth, explosive throw to target, catch and descend immediately
exercises.common_mistake: Pacing too fast early or not hitting target consistently

hyrox_specific.pacing_strategy: Consistent 15-20 rep sets with brief rest

exercises.scientific_explanation: The 1000m SkiErg provides upper body cardiovascular stress unique in HYROX competition. Research shows elite technique focuses on posterior chain drive with minimal upper body fatigue to preserve energy for subsequent stations. Optimal stroke rate is 26-32 strokes per minute.
exercises.competition_metrics: 1000m distance, stroke rate, power output, transition time
exercises.form_cue: Drive down with core and lats, quick hands up, maintain rhythm
exercises.common_mistake: Too fast stroke rate or using arms instead of core drive

hyrox_specific.pacing: Negative split - controlled start, strong finish

exercises.scientific_explanation: The 1000m row occurs after 5 previous stations, requiring pacing strategy and technical efficiency under fatigue. Research shows elite HYROX athletes maintain stroke rates of 28-32 while focusing on leg drive power to minimize upper body fatigue for remaining stations.
research_citations: HYROX Elite Analysis (2023): Rowing under fatigue
exercises.competition_metrics: 1000m distance, stroke rate, split time, fatigue management
exercises.form_cue: Legs drive, back swing, arms pull, reverse sequence on recovery
exercises.common_mistake: Starting too fast or poor technique breakdown under fatigue

exercises.scientific_explanation: HYROX requires 8x 1km runs between functional stations, demanding aerobic efficiency and lactate clearance. Research shows elite athletes maintain 85-90% of their standalone 1km pace while managing fatigue from functional stations. Optimal pacing distributes effort across all 8 running segments.
research_citations: HYROX Performance Lab (2023): Running under functional fatigue
exercises.competition_metrics: 8 x 1km segments, consistent pacing, fatigue management
exercises.form_cue: Controlled effort, efficient stride, save energy for stations
exercises.common_mistake: Starting runs too fast or not accounting for station fatigue

hyrox_specific.pacing_strategy: Even effort with slight negative split

exercises.scientific_explanation: Efficient transitions between running and functional stations are crucial for competitive HYROX times. Research shows elite athletes can save 30-60 seconds through optimized transition techniques, equipment setup, and recovery breathing patterns between high-intensity efforts.
exercises.competition_metrics: Transition time, setup efficiency, immediate readiness
exercises.form_cue: Quick setup, controlled breathing, immediate station engagement
exercises.common_mistake: Wasted movement or not preparing mentally for next station

hyrox_specific.elite_focus: Equipment familiarity, breathing control, mental preparation

exercises.scientific_explanation: Full HYROX simulation replicates the complete competition demands: 8x 1km runs plus 8 functional stations. Research shows simulation training is essential for pacing strategy, nutrition timing, and mental preparation. Elite athletes perform monthly simulations at 90-95% effort.
exercises.competition_metrics: Full race time, station splits, pacing execution, fatigue management
exercises.form_cue: Execute race strategy, maintain technique under fatigue, strategic pacing
exercises.common_mistake: Training too hard in simulation or not practicing race strategy

exercises.scientific_explanation: Double unders develop the anaerobic power and coordination patterns similar to HYROX station demands while improving cardiovascular efficiency. Research shows jump rope training improves coordination, footwork, and anaerobic capacity essential for HYROX competition success.
research_citations: Jump Rope Research (2020): Coordination and conditioning benefits
exercises.competition_metrics: Rope speed, coordination maintenance, anaerobic capacity
exercises.form_cue: Slight knee bend, wrist rotation, maintain rhythm under fatigue
exercises.common_mistake: Too much arm movement or losing rhythm when tired

hyrox_training.application: Anaerobic conditioning similar to station demands
hyrox_training.progression: Build from 50 to 200+ consecutive double unders
